Actions.description: The available actions for this resource.
Actions.longDescription: This type shall contain the available actions for this resource.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Oem.description: The available OEM-specific actions for this resource.
Oem.longDescription: This property shall contain the available OEM-specific actions for this resource.

OemActions.description: The available OEM-specific actions for this resource.
OemActions.longDescription: This type shall contain the available OEM-specific actions for this resource.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Redundancy.description: The common redundancy definition and structure used in other Redfish schemas.
Redundancy.longDescription: This object represents the redundancy element property.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Actions.description: The available actions for this resource.
Actions.longDescription: This property shall contain the available actions for this resource.

MaxNumSupported.description: The maximum number of members allowable for this particular redundancy group.
MaxNumSupported.longDescription: This property shall contain the maximum number of members allowed in the redundancy group.

MemberId.description: The identifier for the member within the collection.
MemberId.longDescription: This property shall uniquely identify the member within the collection.  For services supporting Redfish v1.6 or higher, this value shall contain the zero-based array index.

MinNumNeeded.description: The minimum number of members needed for this group to be redundant.
MinNumNeeded.longDescription: This property shall contain the minimum number of members allowed in the redundancy group for the current redundancy mode to still be fault tolerant.

Mode.description: The redundancy mode of the group.
Mode.longDescription: This property shall contain the information about the redundancy mode of this subsystem.

Name.description: The name of the resource or array member.
Name.longDescription: This object represents the name of this resource or array member.  The resource values shall comply with the Redfish Specification-described requirements.  This string value shall be of the 'Name' reserved word format.

Oem.longDescription: This property shall contain the OEM extensions.  All values for properties that this object contains shall conform to the Redfish Specification-described requirements.

RedundancyEnabled.description: An indication of whether redundancy is enabled.
RedundancyEnabled.longDescription: This property shall indicate whether the redundancy is enabled.

RedundancySet.description: The links to components of this redundancy set.
RedundancySet.longDescription: This property shall contain the links to components that are part of this redundancy set.

Status.description: The status and health of the resource and its subordinate or dependent resources.
Status.longDescription: This property shall contain any status or health properties of the resource.

enumDescriptions.Failover: Failure of one unit automatically causes a standby or offline unit in the redundancy set to take over its functions.
enumDescriptions.N+m: Multiple units are available and active such that normal operation will continue if one or more units fail.
enumDescriptions.NotRedundant: The subsystem is not configured in a redundancy mode, either due to configuration or the functionality has been disabled by the user.
enumDescriptions.Sharing: Multiple units contribute or share such that operation will continue, but at a reduced capacity, if one or more units fail.
enumDescriptions.Sparing: One or more spare units are available to take over the function of a failed unit, but takeover is not automatic.

enumDescriptions.Failover: Failure of one unit automatically causes a standby or offline unit in the redundancy set to take over its functions.
enumDescriptions.NPlusM: Multiple units are available and active such that normal operation will continue if one or more units fail.
enumDescriptions.NotRedundant: The subsystem is not configured in a redundancy mode, either due to configuration or the functionality has been disabled by the user.
enumDescriptions.Sharing: Multiple units contribute or share such that operation will continue, but at a reduced capacity, if one or more units fail.
enumDescriptions.Sparing: One or more spare units are available to take over the function of a failed unit, but takeover is not automatic.

enumLongDescriptions.Failover: This value shall indicate that a failure of one unit automatically causes a standby or offline unit in the redundancy set to take over its functions.
enumLongDescriptions.NPlusM: This value shall indicate that the capacity or services provided by the set of N+M devices can withstand failure of up to M units, with all units in the group normally providing capacity or service.

RedundantGroup.description: The redundancy information for the devices in a redundancy group.
RedundantGroup.longDescription: This type shall contain redundancy information for the set of devices in this redundancy group.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

MaxSupportedInGroup.description: The maximum number of devices supported in this redundancy group.
MaxSupportedInGroup.longDescription: This property shall contain the maximum number of devices allowed in the redundancy group.

MinNeededInGroup.description: The minimum number of devices needed for this group to be redundant.
MinNeededInGroup.longDescription: This property shall contain the minimum number of functional devices needed in the redundancy group for the current redundancy mode to be fault tolerant.

RedundancyGroup.description: The links to the devices included in this redundancy group.
RedundancyGroup.longDescription: This property shall contain the links to the resources that represent the devices that are part of this redundancy group.

RedundancyType.description: The redundancy mode of the group.
RedundancyType.longDescription: This property shall contain the information about the redundancy mode of this redundancy group.

Status.description: The status and health of the resource and its subordinate or dependent resources.
Status.longDescription: This property shall contain any status or health properties of the resource.

title: #Redundancy.v1_4_0
